meanings.sent1: She disserves her classmates by spreading rumors about them.
meanings.sent2: It disserves society when individuals cheat on their taxes.
meanings.sent3: The bully disserves his own reputation by picking on smaller kids.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the needs of others disserves the spirit of community.
meanings.sent5: His selfish behavior clearly disserves the principles of fairness.

meanings.definition: To fail to benefit or help
meanings.sent1: Skipping breakfast disserves your health in the long run.
meanings.sent2: It disserves the team when a player refuses to cooperate.
meanings.sent3: Procrastinating only disserves your own progress in the end.
meanings.sent4: Lack of communication disserves the project's success.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting practice disserves your chances of improvement.
